title: CK2000
content:
I was just playing Keen1, Keen4 (Beat it on Hard, lol), NukemI and II. Then I stumbled on the old versions of Issis II (or w/e its' name was), CK2000, the old DopeFish fan games (Not forgetting Xky's first Mod)...

Anyone remember how entertaining these old games were?~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: CK2000
content:
I remember playing all the fangames at CC314 (and CK2000 before that) and thinking they were the best things ever. I don't think that anymore, but they still have some sort of weird nostolgic charm when I play them.

Isis II demos were fun. Although, for me, they didn't really feel very Keenish.--------------
[url=http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/][img]http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/imgs/links/pccwsml.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: CK2000
content:
It isn't hard to remember that the old games are so good because almost all the modern games are complete crap. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
I still play the classics, especially Keens. Keen fan games I've never really played, thus don't find them very entertaining.
And XkyKeen1 isn't that old, it's only some years old.. But really good mod, agree.Eat your veggies!

title: Re: CK2000
content: [quote]Quote:[hr]I remember playing all the fangames at CC314 (and CK2000 before that) and thinking they were the best things ever. [hr][/quote]Heh, I remember playing all the fangames at CC314, and thinking they were the worst games I'd ever played. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] I kinda liked the dopefish fangame, but if I remember correctly, it was very short.

title: hehe
content:
I remember when I first downloaded CK2000, and being rather upset at the finicky jumping physics and the complete lack of interesting level design. I always find it somewhat discouraging when a fangame recycles old enemies.

Isis II was always a mixed success with me--I liked the fact that there was an increased palette, but I really didn't like the multiple weapons thing. There were original monsters which were pretty well animated, but there was a health meter. There were interesting level design concepts, but the gameplay wasn't quite Keenish. It was still a monumental effort, and I'm thankful for the previews we have/had.

title: hmm
content: huh? wered u get Isis II Ive only heard of plain Isis

title: Re: hmm
content:
There's only one 'Isis' game, and that's Isis II.

Isis II is the name of the planet the game takes place on - not the game number. (I'm pretty sure, anyway)--------------
[url=http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/][img]http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/imgs/links/pccwsml.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: hmm
content:
Yeah that's correct.

My first thought when playing CK2000 was: w00t a new Keen game. That the gameplay was so dreadfull and the enemies recycled from the original games didn't even matter back then. I just didn't know that (average) fangames where that easy to made.

I miss the time of fangames, when I registered there where still some nice fangames in the work. Currently that part of Keenfanart is almost dead.-----------------
[img]http://jamba.nl/storage/view/335/0/cr/CrazyFrog___Axel_F_Rocket.gif[/img]
Jamster! rules!

title: Re: hmm
content:
I like the gameplay though... The level design grew on me, and the game physics also were bearable...

I dunno, just was a kool attempt for the first CKfan game... Well, more than an attempt. Hats off to him (I forget his name.. Alex I think).~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: CK2000
content:
I was a pretty good clicker (user of KnP/TGF/MMF) at the time I played CK2000, and damn it sucked. It then inspired me to make my OWN Keen fangame, which I abandoned, and now restarted :P.

I guess, thanks CK2000, for the motivation and inspiration, though the game sucked. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] DaVince, Yet Another Amateur Game Creator! :P

title: Re: CK2000
content:
No, I disagree...

It's not like AR reallty made the game great as far as controls, but controls are not what makes a game good.

He created a completely different flow --he combined graphics and music in a new way, but still had that classic Keen feel. That is something that has never been done (Atleast, finished) after that, either. (Of course, I'm excluding mods & unfinished fangames)~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...
